message_1:
Here's a math problem on time series analysis for you:

The following data represents the amount of rainfall (in millimeters) in a city for 12 months:

85, 78, 81, 73, 67, 60, 55, 69, 72, 80, 79, 88

Calculate the simple moving average for a window size of 3 and interpret the results.
message_2:
To calculate the simple moving average (SMA) for a window size of 3, we will take the average of every 3 consecutive data points in the given dataset. Here's the calculation:

1. (85 + 78 + 81) / 3 = 244 / 3 = 81.33
2. (78 + 81 + 73) / 3 = 232 / 3 = 77.33
3. (81 + 73 + 67) / 3 = 221 / 3 = 73.67
4. (73 + 67 + 60) / 3 = 200 / 3 = 66.67
5. (67 + 60 + 55) / 3 = 182 / 3 = 60.67
6. (60 + 55 + 69) / 3 = 184 / 3 = 61.33
7. (55 + 69 + 72) / 3 = 196 / 3 = 65.33
8. (69 + 72 + 80) / 3 = 221 / 3 = 73.67
9. (72 + 80 + 79) / 3 = 231 / 3 = 77
10. (80 + 79 + 88) / 3 = 247 / 3 = 82.33

The simple moving averages for a window size of 3 are:

81.33, 77.33, 73.67, 66.67, 60.67, 61.33, 65.33, 73.67, 77, 82.33

Interpretation:

The simple moving average smoothens the original data, which helps in identifying trends in the data. In this case, we can observe that the rainfall decreases from the beginning of the year until around the middle of the year, then starts to increase again. The moving average helps to remove some of the noise in the data and makes it easier to identify patterns and trends.
